subject: History
title: The Golden Age of Islam
description: One-minute skill: The Golden Age of Islam.

hook.text: While Europe struggled through its Dark Ages, Baghdad built the world's greatest library.

buildup.text: The House of Wisdom translated Greek, Persian, and Indian texts. Scholars from every faith gathered.

discovery.text: Al-Khwarizmi invented algebra. Ibn al-Haytham founded modern optics. Ibn Sina wrote medicine's bible.

twist.text: When the Mongols destroyed Baghdad in 1258, they threw so many books in the Tigris it ran black with ink.

climax.text: European universities later translated Arabic texts, reigniting their own scientific revolution.

punchline.text: The Renaissance was partly written in Arabic.

quiz.question: What happened when the Mongols sacked Baghdad in 1258?
options: They preserved the libraries for their own use
Books were thrown in the river, turning it black with ink
The scholars escaped to Europe with their texts
